reasoning: Creating a seed script with Excel parsing. Contained to backend with single well-documented dependency (openpyxl). Assumes equipment template models and migration already exist from previous subtasks (018-1-1 through 014-1-5).

scope.notes: Main seed script, requirements.txt for openpyxl dependency, possibly seed runner if doesn't exist. Backend only.

integrations.notes: Excel parsing with openpyxl is well-documented and standard. Source file exists: רשימת ציוד לאישור.xlsx

infrastructure.notes: Assumes database schema already exists (created in subtasks 018-1-1, 017-1-2, and 014-1-5). This task only populates data.

knowledge.notes: No existing seed scripts found in codebase, but seeding is a standard pattern. openpyxl is well-known library.

concerns: Many-to-many relationships between templates and consultants must be handled correctly
Consultant types must exist in database before creating template associations
Bilingual content (Hebrew/English) requires proper UTF-8 encoding
Seed script should be idempotent (safe to run multiple times)
Excel file structure must be parsed correctly to extract 11 equipment types with their metadata
risk.notes: Data integrity is critical. Need proper validation and relationship handling. Task depends on completion of 5 previous subtasks (models, schemas, migration).

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Database seeding affects data integrity. Requires unit tests to verify Excel parsing and data structure correctness, plus integration tests to ensure database records are created with proper relationships. No security-sensitive operations beyond normal database access.
